snippet: Gap expects its sales in China to triple in the next three years to $1 billion, making the country its second-largest market, the retailer said on Wednesday.
abstract: Gap says it expects its sales in China to triple in the next three years to $1 billion, making the country its second-largest market.
lead_paragraph: Gap expects its sales in China to triple in the next three years to $1 billion, making the country its second-largest market, the retailer said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Gap Predicts Sales in China Will Triple in Next Three Years
headline.print_headline: Gap Predicts Sales in China Will Triple in Next Three Years
